          • Methods Summary

              Methods 
              Type Name and description
              void addFile(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest)
              The ADD instruction copies new files, directories or remote file URLs from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .
              void addFile(groovy.lang.Closure src, groovy.lang.Closure dest)
              The ADD instruction copies new files, directories or remote file URLs from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .
              void copyFile(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest)
              The COPY instruction copies new files or directories from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .
              void copyFile(groovy.lang.Closure src, groovy.lang.Closure dest)
              The COPY instruction copies new files or directories from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .
              void create()
              void defaultCommand(java.lang.String... command)
              The main purpose of a CMD instruction is to provide defaults for an executing container.
              void entryPoint(java.lang.String... entryPoint)
              An ENTRYPOINT allows you to configure a container that will run as an executable.
              void entryPoint(groovy.lang.Closure entryPoint)
              An ENTRYPOINT allows you to configure a container that will run as an executable.
              void environmentVariable(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
              The ENV instruction sets the environment variable to the value .
              void exposePort(java.lang.Integer... ports)
              The EXPOSE instruction informs Docker that the container will listen on the specified network ports at runtime.
              void exposePort(groovy.lang.Closure ports)
              The EXPOSE instruction informs Docker that the container will listen on the specified network ports at runtime.
              void from(java.lang.String image)
              The FROM instruction sets the Base Image for subsequent instructions.
              void from(groovy.lang.Closure image)
              The FROM instruction sets the Base Image for subsequent instructions.
              void instruction(java.lang.String instruction)
              Adds a full instruction as String.
              void instruction(groovy.lang.Closure instruction)
              Adds a full instruction as Closure with return type String.
              void maintainer(java.lang.String maintainer)
              The MAINTAINER instruction allows you to set the Author field of the generated images.
              void maintainer(groovy.lang.Closure maintainer)
              The MAINTAINER instruction allows you to set the Author field of the generated images.
              void onBuild(java.lang.String instruction)
              The ONBUILD instruction adds to the image a trigger instruction to be executed at a later time, when the image is used as the base for another build.
              void runCommand(java.lang.String command)
              The RUN instruction will execute any commands in a new layer on top of the current image and commit the results.
              void user(java.lang.String user)
              The USER instruction sets the user name or UID to use when running the image and for any RUN, CMD and ENTRYPOINT instructions that follow it in the Dockerfile.
              void volume(java.lang.String... volume)
              The VOLUME instruction will create a mount point with the specified name and mark it as holding externally mounted volumes from native host or other containers.
              void workingDir(java.lang.String dir)
              The WORKDIR instruction sets the working directory for any RUN, CMD and ENTRYPOINT instructions that follow it in the Dockerfile.

            • void addFile(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dest)

              The ADD instruction copies new files, directories or remote file URLs from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .

              Parameters:
              src - Source file
              dest - Destination path

            • void addFile(groovy.lang.Closure src, groovy.lang.Closure dest)

              The ADD instruction copies new files, directories or remote file URLs from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .

              Parameters:
              src - Source file
              dest - Destination path

              The COPY instruction copies new files or directories from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .

              Parameters:
              src - Source file
              dest - Destination path

              The COPY instruction copies new files or directories from and adds them to the filesystem of the container at the path .

              Parameters:
              src - Source file
              dest - Destination path

            • @org.gradle.api.tasks.TaskAction void create()

            • void defaultCommand(java.lang.String... command)

              The main purpose of a CMD instruction is to provide defaults for an executing container.

              Parameters:
              command - Command

            • void entryPoint(java.lang.String... entryPoint)

              An ENTRYPOINT allows you to configure a container that will run as an executable.

              Parameters:
              entryPoint - Entry point

            • void entryPoint(groovy.lang.Closure entryPoint)

              An ENTRYPOINT allows you to configure a container that will run as an executable.

              Parameters:
              entryPoint - Entry point

            • void environmentVariable(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)

              The ENV instruction sets the environment variable to the value . This value will be passed to all future RUN instructions.

              Parameters:
              key - Key
              value - Value

            • void exposePort(java.lang.Integer... ports)

              The EXPOSE instruction informs Docker that the container will listen on the specified network ports at runtime.

              Parameters:
              ports - Ports

            • void exposePort(groovy.lang.Closure ports)

              The EXPOSE instruction informs Docker that the container will listen on the specified network ports at runtime.

              Parameters:
              ports - Ports

            • void from(java.lang.String image)

              The FROM instruction sets the Base Image for subsequent instructions.

              Parameters:
              image - Base image name

            • void from(groovy.lang.Closure image)

              The FROM instruction sets the Base Image for subsequent instructions.

              Parameters:
              image - Base image name

            • void instruction(java.lang.String instruction)

              Adds a full instruction as String. Example: 

               task createDockerfile(type: Dockerfile) {
     instruction 'FROM ubuntu:14.04'
     instruction 'MAINTAINER Benjamin Muschko "benjamin.muschko@gmail.com"'
 }
              Parameters:
              instruction - Instruction as String

            • void instruction(groovy.lang.Closure instruction)

              Adds a full instruction as Closure with return type String. Example: 

               task createDockerfile(type: Dockerfile) {
     instruction { 'FROM ubuntu:14.04' }
     instruction { 'MAINTAINER Benjamin Muschko "benjamin.muschko@gmail.com"' }
 }
              Parameters:
              instruction - Instruction as Closure

            • void maintainer(java.lang.String maintainer)

              The MAINTAINER instruction allows you to set the Author field of the generated images.

              Parameters:
              maintainer - Maintainer

            • void maintainer(groovy.lang.Closure maintainer)

              The MAINTAINER instruction allows you to set the Author field of the generated images.

              Parameters:
              maintainer - Maintainer

            • void onBuild(java.lang.String instruction)

              The ONBUILD instruction adds to the image a trigger instruction to be executed at a later time, when the image is used as the base for another build.

              Parameters:
              instruction - Instruction

            • void runCommand(java.lang.String command)

              The RUN instruction will execute any commands in a new layer on top of the current image and commit the results.

              Parameters:
              command - Command

            • void user(java.lang.String user)

              The USER instruction sets the user name or UID to use when running the image and for any RUN, CMD and ENTRYPOINT instructions that follow it in the Dockerfile.

              Parameters:
              user - User

            • void volume(java.lang.String... volume)

              The VOLUME instruction will create a mount point with the specified name and mark it as holding externally mounted volumes from native host or other containers.

              Parameters:
              volume - Volume

            • void workingDir(java.lang.String dir)

              The WORKDIR instruction sets the working directory for any RUN, CMD and ENTRYPOINT instructions that follow it in the Dockerfile.

              Parameters:
              dir - Directory
